page.title: 15THE BUTCHER
page.content: Mr Dixon, the Butcher, whose shop is in Main Street was interviewed. His house dates back to 1770 and it used to be called Pinfold Cottage until his grandmother planted a Walnut tree in the garden and it became known as Walnut Cottage. It is now known as 35 Main Street. Somewhere in the line of Dixons is a Lord Mayor of London. Mr Dixon still does his own slaughtering in the yard at the back of the shop. He works a very long day but he wouldn't change his job. Fillet steak is the most expensive cut of meat, and breast of lamb the cheapest. Some of the tools he uses are; cleavers, skewers, saws, and a variety of knives.
